overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, an object moving along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis is initially moving in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction with a speed of <math alttext="1.0 meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>. The object’s velocity is measured in one-second intervals and recorded in the table. Which of the following claims best describes the kinetic energy of the object?

choices.label: The object’s kinetic energy decreases, then increases.
The object’s kinetic energy increases, then decreases.
The object’s kinetic energy increases throughout the entire time interval.
The object’s kinetic energy decreases throughout the entire time interval.

content.answer: The object’s kinetic energy decreases, then increases.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
